title: Gazi Anadolu Lisesi
text:
Gazi Anatolian High School (Gazi in short) is a <a href="co-education">co-education</a>al <a href="Anatolian%20High%20School">Anatolian High School</a> in <a href="Ankara">Ankara</a>, Turkey. It was founded under the name "Söğütözü Anatolian High School" in 1984. In 1986 it moved to its current location and adopted the current name. The emblem of the school is the signature of <a href="Mustafa%20Kemal%20Atat%C3%BCrk">Mustafa Kemal Atatürk</a>, which is worn every Gazi student on their uniform.
According to <a href="OKS%20Turkey">High School Entrance Examinations in Turkey</a>, Gazi is consistently ranked among the top ten high schools in Turkey (ninth in 2006 and fourth in 2005). Gazi students average in the top <a href="percentile">percentile</a> of all students taking the Turkish high school entrance exam. Gazi students score outstanding results in <a href="%C3%96SS">Student Selection Exam</a> thus ranking Gazi one of the most successful <a href="Anatolian%20high%20school">Anatolian high school</a>s in Turkey.
Gazi is one of the largest primary education institutions in Ankara, with an administrative and classroom building, a gymnasium/sports center, a canteen and a student dormitory on campus. The primary language of instruction in the school is Turkish but students take obligatory English lessons as a foreign language.
